sentence.Network_en: I hear the house is getting to be real classy.

sentence.Network_en: It was a real classy act he pulled in the bathtub.
sentence.Network_cn: 他在浴缸里被捕才是真正的优秀行为.

list.abs: at 50 , back to a very classic and enduring look showing a sense of refined sophistication after living through the many decades ; tastes have been distilled and generally looks more classy .50岁，经过多年之后回到非常经典传统的品位，表露出一种洗练过的优雅。品位已经升华看上去更加时尚。

encyclopedia.content: classy 由光文社出版针对20代女性所推出的时尚杂志，CLASSY的意思是高级、优雅、品味的，提供脱离JJ年纪女生另一个流行的参考。风格依旧强调带点华丽感的打扮，介绍的饰品与小物也比较奢华。 英语解释 classy英音：['klɑ:si]美音：['klæsɪ] 形容词 a. 1.优等的 2.漂亮的；别致的 a.【口】高级的；有气派的；时髦的，漂亮的 a. 【口】高级的；有气派的；时髦的，漂亮的 比较级：classier,clas

entry.tran: 有气派的;时尚的;高级的
entry.def: If you describe someone or something as classy, you mean they are stylish and sophisticated.

example.ex: The German star put in a classy performance...
example.tran: 这位德国明星展示了一流演技。

example.ex: Both GM and Ford believe they need classier brand names to sell upmarket cars.
example.tran: 通用汽车公司和福特公司都认为它们需要用更有气派的品牌名称销售高档车。
